fields.description: External reference to the `CreditMemo`. Must be unique.

This mutation creates a `Fulfilment`, an orchestratable entity inside the Fluent ecosystem. If the `Fulfilment` is successfully created, a CREATE event will be generate associated with the mutation.
A sample of the event generated:
{
    "name": "CREATE",
    "type": "NORMAL",
    "entityRef": "FULFILMENT-001",
    "entityType": "FULFILMENT",
    "retailerId": "1",
    "accountId": "ACCOUNT_ID"
}
External reference of the object. Recommended to be unique.

The current status of the `Fulfilment`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration
The location (i.e. store) id provided by the retailer
The location status. Possible values are 'ACTIVE', 'INACTIVE'.

The current status of the `Order`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration
The current status of the Order.

This mutation creates a `FinancialTransaction`, an orchestratable entity inside the Fluent ecosystem. If the `FinancialTransaction` is successfully created, a CREATE event will be generate associated with the mutation.
A sample of the event generated:
{
    "name": "CREATE",
    "type": "NORMAL",
    "entityRef": "FINANCIALTRANSACTION-001",
    "entityType": "FINANCIALTRANSACTION",
    "retailerId": "1",
    "accountId": "ACCOUNT_ID"
}
The unique transaction reference provided by the Retailer to the payment gateway
External reference for `ReturnOrder`. Must be unique.
A list of edges that links to BillingAccount type node
The item at the end of the BillingAccount edge
External reference to the `BillingAccount`. Must be unique.
Type of the `BillingAccount`, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied.
External reference to the `CreditMemo`. Must be unique.
A list of attributes associated with the `CreditMemo`. This can be used to extend the existing data structure with additional data.
Type of the attribute's `value`. This is a free string and can be used by the client to interpret and cast the `value` into the appropriate type.
The tariff of the Tax Type
A group field which can be used to further identify the Tax Tariff applicable
The country in which this Tax Type applies
Reference to the currency type. Generally, the standard ISO-4217 is used.
Type of the `CreditMemo`, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied.
Reference to a `ReturnOrder` associated with the `CreditMemo`.
A list of edges that links to CreditMemoItem type node
The item at the end of the CreditMemoItem edge
External reference to the `CreditMemoItem`. Must be unique.
Type of the `CreditMemoItem`, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied.
The item amount for this item excluding tax. This is a calculated value based on business rules that does not necessarily have to take into account the unit quantity or amounts.
Reference to an `OrderItem` associated with the `CreditMemoItem`.
The tax amount for this item. If not present at the item level, tax amount should be generated based on the tax type set at the invoice parent level.
Reference to a `Product` associated with the `CreditMemoItem`.
The unit sale price at time of sale or exchange
The unit cost price at time of sale or exchange.
`unitQuantity` holds separately the amount and the unit associated.
The tax type of this item. Should only be provided if different to the default credit memo tax type.
The country in which this Tax Type applies
A group field which can be used to further identify the Tax Tariff applicable
The tariff of the Tax Type
Reference to an `Order` associated with the `CreditMemo`.
External reference to the `BillingAccount`. Must be unique.

operations.source:
query GetFulfillmentByRef($ref: [String!], $fulfilmentCount: Int, $fulfilmentCursor: String, $includeAttributes: Boolean!, $includeItems: Boolean!, $includefromAddress: Boolean!, $includeOrder: Boolean!, $includeToAddress: Boolean!, $fulfilmentItemsCount: Int, $fulfilmentItemsCursor: String, $withOrderItem: Boolean!) {
  fulfilments(ref: $ref, first: $fulfilmentCount, after: $fulfilmentCursor) {
    __typename
    edges {
      __typename
      node {
        __typename
        id
        ref
        status
        createdOn
        updatedOn
        deliveryType
        type
        eta
        expiryTime
        order @include(if: $includeOrder) {
          __typename
          id
          ref
          type
          status
        }
        user {
          __typename
          firstName
          lastName
          username
          primaryEmail
          primaryPhone
          title
          ref
        }
        attributes @include(if: $includeAttributes) {
          __typename
          name
          type
          value
        }
        fromAddress @include(if: $includefromAddress) {
          __typename
          id
          type
          createdOn
          name
          street
          city
          state
          postcode
          region
          country
          latitude
          longitude
        }
        toAddress @include(if: $includeToAddress) {
          __typename
          id
          type
          createdOn
          companyName
          name
          street
          city
          state
          postcode
          region
          country
          latitude
          longitude
          ref
        }
        items(first: $fulfilmentItemsCount, after: $fulfilmentItemsCursor) @include(if: $includeItems) {
          __typename
          edges {
            __typename
            item: node {
              __typename
              id
              ref
              status
              requestedQuantity
              filledQuantity
              rejectedQuantity
              orderItem @include(if: $withOrderItem) {
                __typename
                id
                createdOn
                updatedOn
                ref
                quantity
                paidPrice
                currency
                totalPrice
                totalTaxPrice
                price
                taxPrice
                attributes {
                  __typename
                  name
                  type
                  value
                }
                product {
                  __typename
                  name
                  ... on VariantProduct {
                    ref
                  }
                }
              }
            }
            cursor
          }
          pageInfo {
            __typename
            hasNextPage
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

fields.description: A list of edges that links to Fulfilment type node
The item at the end of the Fulfilment edge
External reference of the object. Recommended to be unique.

The current status of the `Fulfilment`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration
Type of delivery. Supported values are _STANDARD_, _OVERNIGHT_ and _EXPRESS_.

Type of the `Fulfilment`, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied. Unless stated otherwise, no values are enforced by the platform.
Type of the Fulfilment. Supports all values.
The estimated time of completing the fulfilment.
External reference of the object. Must be unique.

Type of the `Order`, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied. Unless stated otherwise, no values are enforced by the platform.
Type of the Order, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied. Unless stated otherwise, no values are enforced by the platform. Currently supports all values.

The current status of the `Order`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration
The current status of the Order.
Type of the attribute's `value`. This is a free string and can be used by the client to interpret and cast the `value` into the appropriate type.
Type of Address, to support legacy address, the value can be AGENT and ORDER
Type of Address, to support legacy address, the value can be AGENT and ORDER
A list of edges that links to FulfilmentItem type node
The item at the end of the FulfilmentItem edge
External reference of the object. Recommended to be unique.
Number of `OrderItem`s assigned to the fulfilment
External reference of the object. Recommended to be unique.
Currency. Should ideally be a 3 letter ISO currency code. For instance _AUD_.
Type of the attribute's `value`. This is a free string and can be used by the client to interpret and cast the `value` into the appropriate type.
Represents the `Product` corresponding to this object
The unique reference identifier for the Product
A cursor for use in pagination
true if there are one or more pages of items beyond the current page

query GetFulfillmentByRef($ref: [String!], $fulfilmentCount: Int, $fulfilmentCursor: String, $includeAttributes: Boolean!, $includeItems: Boolean!, $includefromAddress: Boolean!, $includeOrder: Boolean!, $includeToAddress: Boolean!, $fulfilmentItemsCount: Int, $fulfilmentItemsCursor: String, $withOrderItem: Boolean!) {
  fulfilments(ref: $ref, first: $fulfilmentCount, after: $fulfilmentCursor) {
    __typename
    edges {
      __typename
      node {
        __typename
        id
        ref
        status
        createdOn
        updatedOn
        deliveryType
        type
        eta
        expiryTime
        order @include(if: $includeOrder) {
          __typename
          id
          ref
          type
          status
        }
        user {
          __typename
          firstName
          lastName
          username
          primaryEmail
          primaryPhone
          title
          ref
        }
        attributes @include(if: $includeAttributes) {
          __typename

        }
        fromAddress @include(if: $includefromAddress) {
          __typename
          id
          type
          createdOn
          name
          street
          city
          state

          region

          type
          createdOn
          companyName
          name
          street
          city
          state
          postcode
          region
          country
          latitude
          longitude
          ref
        }
        items(first: $fulfilmentItemsCount, after: $fulfilmentItemsCursor) @include(if: $includeItems) {
          __typename
          edges {
            __typename
            item: node {
              __typename
              id
              ref
              status
              requestedQuantity
              filledQuantity
              rejectedQuantity
              orderItem @include(if: $withOrderItem) {
                __typename

              }
            }

        }
      }
    }
  }
}

operations.source:
query GetLocationById($id: ID!, $networkCount: Int, $networkCursor: String, $includeNetworks: Boolean!) {
  locationById(id: $id) {
    __typename
    ref
    type
    status
    createdOn
    updatedOn
    name
    supportPhoneNumber
    defaultCarrier
    retailer {
      __typename
      id
    }
    defaultCarrier
    defaultCarrierName
    networks(first: $networkCount, after: $networkCursor) @include(if: $includeNetworks) {
      __typename
      edges {
        __typename
        node {
          __typename
          id
          ref
          type
          status
        }
      }
    }
    primaryAddress {
      __typename
      id
      type
      createdOn
      updatedOn
      companyName
      name
      street
      city
      state
      postcode
      region
      country
      latitude
      latitude
      timeZone
    }
    attributes {
      __typename
      name
      type
      value
    }
  }
}

fields.description: The location (i.e. store) id provided by the retailer
The location status. Possible values are 'ACTIVE', 'INACTIVE'.
Networks the location is assigned to
A list of edges that links to Network type node
The item at the end of the Network edge
Reference to the network. This is the name of the network you passed in while creating the network. Recommended to be unique.
Store location of the the location
Type of Address, to support legacy address, the value can be AGENT and ORDER
Type of the attribute's `value`. This is a free string and can be used by the client to interpret and cast the `value` into the appropriate type.

operations.source:
query GetLocationsByRefs($locationRef: [String], $locationCount: Int, $locationCursor: String, $includeLocations: Boolean!) {
  locations(ref: $locationRef, first: $locationCount, after: $locationCursor) @include(if: $includeLocations) {
    __typename
    pageInfo {
      __typename
      hasNextPage
    }
    edges {
      __typename
      cursor
      node {
        __typename
        id
        ref
        type
        status
        name
        primaryAddress {
          __typename
          id
          ref
          type
          companyName
          name
          street
          city
          state
          postcode
          region
          country
          latitude
          longitude
          timeZone
        }
        attributes {
          __typename
          type
          name
          value
        }
        openingSchedule {
          __typename
          id
          createdOn
          updatedOn
          allHours
          monEnd
          monStart
          tueEnd
          tueStart
          wedEnd
          wedStart
          thuEnd
          thuStart
          friEnd
          friStart
          satEnd
          satStart
          sunEnd
          sunStart
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

Store location of the the location
Type of Address, to support legacy address, the value can be AGENT and ORDER
Type of the attribute's `value`. This is a free string and can be used by the client to interpret and cast the `value` into the appropriate type.

operations.source:
query GetOrderById($id: ID!, $includeCustomer: Boolean!, $includeAttributes: Boolean!, $includeFulfilmentChoice: Boolean!, $includeOrderItems: Boolean!, $includeFulfilments: Boolean!, $fulfilmentRef: [String], $orderItemCount: Int, $orderItemCursor: String, $fulfilmentCount: Int, $fulfilmentCursor: String) {
  orderById(id: $id) {
    __typename
    id
    ref
    type
    status
    createdOn
    updatedOn
    totalPrice
    totalTaxPrice
    orderItems: items(first: $orderItemCount, after: $orderItemCursor) @include(if: $includeOrderItems) {
      __typename
      orderItemEdge: edges {
        __typename
        orderItemNode: node {
          __typename
          id
          ref
          quantity
          paidPrice
          currency
          price
          taxType
          taxPrice
          totalPrice
          totalTaxPrice
          status
          taxType
          orderItemAttributes: attributes {
            __typename
            name
            type
            value
          }
          product {
            __typename
            ... on VariantProduct {
              id
              ref
              type
              status
              variantProductAttributes: attributes {
                __typename
                name
                type
                value
              }
              gtin
              name
              summary
              prices {
                __typename
                type
                currency
                value
              }
              tax {
                __typename
                country
                group
                tariff
              }
              catalogue {
                __typename
                ref
              }
            }
          }
        }
        cursor
      }
      pageInfo {
        __typename
        hasNextPage
      }
    }
    fulfilments(first: $fulfilmentCount, after: $fulfilmentCursor, ref: $fulfilmentRef) @include(if: $includeFulfilments) {
      __typename
      fulfilmentsEdges: edges {
        __typename
        fulfilmentsNode: node {
          __typename
          id
          ref
          type
          status
          type
          createdOn
          updatedOn
          fulfilmentAttributes: attributes {
            __typename
            name
            value
            type
          }
          deliveryType
          fromLocation {
            __typename
            ref
          }
          fromAddress {
            __typename
            ref
            id
            name
          }
          toAddress {
            __typename
            ref
            id
          }
        }
        cursor
      }
      pageInfo {
        __typename
        hasNextPage
      }
    }
    customer @include(if: $includeCustomer) {
      __typename
      id
      ref
      title
      country
      firstName
      lastName
      username
      primaryEmail
      primaryPhone
    }
    attributes @include(if: $includeAttributes) {
      __typename
      name
      value
      type
    }
    fulfilmentChoice @include(if: $includeFulfilmentChoice) {
      __typename
      id
      createdOn
      updatedOn
      currency
      deliveryInstruction
      fulfilmentPrice
      deliveryType
      fulfilmentPrice
      fulfilmentType
      fulfilmentTaxPrice
      pickupLocationRef
      deliveryAddress {
        __typename
        id
        type
        companyName
        name
        street
        city
        state
        postcode
        region
        country
        region
        ref
        latitude
        longitude
        createdOn
        updatedOn
      }
    }
  }
}

By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.

Type of the attribute's `value`. This is a free string and can be used by the client to interpret and cast the `value` into the appropriate type.
Type of delivery. Supported values are _STANDARD_, _OVERNIGHT_ and _EXPRESS_.
A cursor for use in pagination
true if there are one or more pages of items beyond the current page
The country the customer is operating from
Type of the attribute's `value`. This is a free string and can be used by the client to interpret and cast the `value` into the appropriate type.
The `FulfilmentChoice` specified when booking the order
The type of currency, 3 letter ISO currency code.
Instruction provided by the customer (250 character limit).
FulfilmentPrice refers to shipping and C&C fees.
The type of delivery determined by retailers' shipping options. Example values are STANDARD, EXPRESS, OVERNIGHT, 3HOURS
This refers to the tax cost associated with the fulfilment price.
Pickup location. Required if it is a click & collect.
Delivery address. Required if it is a home delivery.
Type of Address, to support legacy address, the value can be AGENT and ORDER

operations.sourceWithFragments:
query GetOrderById($id: ID!, $includeCustomer: Boolean!, $includeAttributes: Boolean!, $includeFulfilmentChoice: Boolean!, $includeOrderItems: Boolean!, $includeFulfilments: Boolean!, $fulfilmentRef: [String], $orderItemCount: Int, $orderItemCursor: String, $fulfilmentCount: Int, $fulfilmentCursor: String) {
  orderById(id: $id) {
    __typename
    id
    ref
    type
    status
    createdOn
    updatedOn
    totalPrice
    totalTaxPrice
    orderItems: items(first: $orderItemCount, after: $orderItemCursor) @include(if: $includeOrderItems) {
      __typename
      orderItemEdge: edges {
        __typename
        orderItemNode: node {
          __typename
          id
          ref
          quantity
          paidPrice
          currency
          price
          taxType
          taxPrice
          totalPrice
          totalTaxPrice
          status
          taxType
          orderItemAttributes: attributes {
            __typename
            name
            type
            value
          }
          product {
            __typename
            ... on VariantProduct {
              id
              ref
              type
              status
              variantProductAttributes: attributes {
                __typename
                name
                type
                value
              }
              gtin
              name
              summary
              prices {
                __typename
                type
                currency
                value
              }
              tax {
                __typename
                country
                group
                tariff
              }
              catalogue {
                __typename
                ref
              }
            }
          }
        }
        cursor
      }
      pageInfo {
        __typename
        hasNextPage
      }
    }
    fulfilments(first: $fulfilmentCount, after: $fulfilmentCursor, ref: $fulfilmentRef) @include(if: $includeFulfilments) {
      __typename
      fulfilmentsEdges: edges {
        __typename
        fulfilmentsNode: node {
          __typename
          id
          ref
          type
          status
          type
          createdOn
          updatedOn
          fulfilmentAttributes: attributes {
            __typename
            name
            value
            type
          }
          deliveryType
          fromLocation {
            __typename
            ref
          }
          fromAddress {
            __typename
            ref
            id
            name
          }
          toAddress {
            __typename
            ref
            id
          }
        }
        cursor
      }
      pageInfo {
        __typename
        hasNextPage
      }
    }
    customer @include(if: $includeCustomer) {
      __typename
      id
      ref
      title
      country
      firstName
      lastName
      username
      primaryEmail
      primaryPhone
    }
    attributes @include(if: $includeAttributes) {
      __typename
      name
      value
      type
    }
    fulfilmentChoice @include(if: $includeFulfilmentChoice) {
      __typename
      id
      createdOn
      updatedOn
      currency
      deliveryInstruction
      fulfilmentPrice
      deliveryType
      fulfilmentPrice
      fulfilmentType
      fulfilmentTaxPrice
      pickupLocationRef
      deliveryAddress {
        __typename
        id
        type
        companyName
        name
        street
        city
        state
        postcode
        region
        country
        region
        ref
        latitude
        longitude
        createdOn
        updatedOn
      }
    }
  }
}

operations.source:
query GetOrdersByRef($ref: [String], $orderItemCount: Int, $orderItemCursor: String, $includeOrderItems: Boolean!, $includeFulfilmentChoice: Boolean!, $includeCustomer: Boolean!, $includeFulfilments: Boolean!, $fulfilmentRef: [String], $fulfilmentCount: Int, $fulfilmentCursor: String) {
  orders(ref: $ref) {
    __typename
    edges {
      __typename
      node {
        __typename
        id
        ref
        type
        status
        createdOn
        updatedOn
        totalPrice
        totalTaxPrice
        attributes {
          __typename
          name
          type
          value
        }
        items(first: $orderItemCount, after: $orderItemCursor) @include(if: $includeOrderItems) {
          __typename
          itemEdges: edges {
            __typename
            itemNode: node {
              __typename
              id
              ref
              quantity
              paidPrice
              currency
              price
              taxPrice
              totalTaxPrice
              totalPrice
              attributes {
                __typename
                name
                value
                type
              }
            }
          }
        }
        fulfilmentChoice @include(if: $includeFulfilmentChoice) {
          __typename
          id
          createdOn
          updatedOn
          currency
          deliveryInstruction
          deliveryType
          fulfilmentPrice
          fulfilmentTaxPrice
          fulfilmentTaxPrice
          fulfilmentType
          pickupLocationRef
          deliveryAddress {
            __typename
            id
            type
            companyName
            name
            street
            city
            state
            postcode
            region
            country
            region
            ref
            latitude
            longitude
          }
        }
        customer @include(if: $includeCustomer) {
          __typename
          id
          ref
          title
          country
          firstName
          lastName
          username
          primaryEmail
          primaryPhone
        }
        financialTransactions {
          __typename
          edges {
            __typename
            node {
              __typename
              id
              ref
              type
              status
              createdOn
              updatedOn
              total
              currency
              externalTransactionCode
              externalTransactionId
              cardType
              paymentMethod
              paymentProviderName
            }
          }
        }
        fulfilments(first: $fulfilmentCount, after: $fulfilmentCursor, ref: $fulfilmentRef) @include(if: $includeFulfilments) {
          __typename
          fulfilmentEdges: edges {
            __typename
            fulfilmentNode: node {
              __typename
              id
              ref
              type
              status
              type
              createdOn
              updatedOn
              fromAddress {
                __typename
                ref
                id
                type
                name
                street
                city
                state
                postcode
                country
                latitude
                longitude
              }
              toAddress {
                __typename
                ref
                type
                id
                name
                street
                city
                state
                postcode
                country
                latitude
                longitude
              }
              attributes {
                __typename
                name
                type
                value
              }
            }
          }
        }
      }
    }
  }
}

fields.description: A list of edges that links to Order type node
The item at the end of the Order edge
External reference of the object. Must be unique.

Type of the `Order`, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied. Unless stated otherwise, no values are enforced by the platform.
Type of the Order, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied. Unless stated otherwise, no values are enforced by the platform. Currently supports all values.

The current status of the `Order`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration
The current status of the Order.
Type of the attribute's `value`. This is a free string and can be used by the client to interpret and cast the `value` into the appropriate type.
A list of edges that links to OrderItem type node
The item at the end of the OrderItem edge
External reference of the object. Recommended to be unique.
Currency. Should ideally be a 3 letter ISO currency code. For instance _AUD_.
Type of the attribute's `value`. This is a free string and can be used by the client to interpret and cast the `value` into the appropriate type.
The `FulfilmentChoice` specified when booking the order
The type of currency, 3 letter ISO currency code.
Instruction provided by the customer (250 character limit).
The type of delivery determined by retailers' shipping options. Example values are STANDARD, EXPRESS, OVERNIGHT, 3HOURS
FulfilmentPrice refers to shipping and C&C fees.
This refers to the tax cost associated with the fulfilment price.
Pickup location. Required if it is a click & collect.
Delivery address. Required if it is a home delivery.
Type of Address, to support legacy address, the value can be AGENT and ORDER
The country the customer is operating from
A list of edges that links to FinancialTransaction type node
The item at the end of the FinancialTransaction edge
The unique transaction reference provided by the Retailer to the payment gateway
Type of the `FinancialTransaction`, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied. Unless stated otherwise, no values are enforced by the platform.

The current status of the `FinancialTransaction`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration
The unique transaction code or request code provided by the payment gateway
The unique transaction ID or request ID provided by the payment gateway
The card type used for the payment. Possible values are 'MASTERCARD', 'VISA', 'AMEX', 'DINERS', 'SPAN', 'DISCOVER', 'UNIONPAY', 'JCB', 'MAESTRO', 'INTERAC'.

The way in which payment was made. Platform provides support for the following payment methods - 'CREDITCARD', 'PAYPAL', 'GIFTVOUCHER', 'CASH', 'AFTERPAY'. However, these
 can be overridden/configured per client as settings

The name of the payment gateway. Platform provided values are 'CYBERSOURCE', 'GIVEX', 'PAYPAL', 'BRAINTREE', 'AFTERPAY'. However, these can be overridden/configured per client as settings using 'PAYMENT.PROVIDER'
A list of edges that links to Fulfilment type node
The item at the end of the Fulfilment edge
External reference of the object. Recommended to be unique.

Type of the `Fulfilment`, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied. Unless stated otherwise, no values are enforced by the platform.

The current status of the `Fulfilment`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration
Type of Address, to support legacy address, the value can be AGENT and ORDER
Type of Address, to support legacy address, the value can be AGENT and ORDER
Type of the attribute's `value`. This is a free string and can be used by the client to interpret and cast the `value` into the appropriate type.

fields.name: ref
fields.description:
External reference to the `CreditMemo`. Must be unique.
Max character limit: 100.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
Type of the `CreditMemo`, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied.
Max character limit: 50.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A list of attributes associated with the `CreditMemo`. This can be used to extend the existing data structure with additional data.

fields.name: order
fields.description: Reference to an `Order` associated with the `CreditMemo`.

fields.name: returnOrder
fields.description: Reference to a `ReturnOrder` associated with the `CreditMemo`.

fields.name: defaultTaxType
fields.description: The default Tax Type for this credit memo. Individual credit memo items can override

fields.name: subTotalAmount
fields.description: The total amount of this credit memo excluding tax

fields.name: totalTax
fields.description: The total amount of tax for this credit memo

fields.name: totalAmount
fields.description: The total amount of this credit memo including tax

fields.name: totalBalance
fields.description: The total amount of this credit memo yet to be paid. (This caters for multi-part payments and payment milestones)

typesUsed.name: AttributeInput
typesUsed.description: Input type for `attribute`s. Attributes should be unique by `name`. If an attribute with a matching `name` already exists, then the `type` and `value` fields will be updated, else they will be inserted.

typesUsed.name: Json
typesUsed.description: Plain JSON object

typesUsed.name: BillingAccountKey
typesUsed.description: Input type to uniquely identify a `BillingAccount` object. We use all the fields present in the request to look for this object.

fields.name: ref
fields.description: The client's reference identifier for the object

fields.name: ref
fields.description:
External reference to the `CreditMemoItem`. Must be unique.
Max character limit: 100.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
Type of the `CreditMemoItem`, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied.
Max character limit: 50.

fields.name: orderItem
fields.description: Reference to an `OrderItem` associated with the `CreditMemoItem`.

fields.name: returnOrderItem
fields.description: Reference to a `ReturnOrderItem` associated with the `CreditMemoItem`.

fields.name: product
fields.description: Reference to a `Product` associated with the `CreditMemoItem`.

fields.name: unitQuantity
fields.description: `unitQuantity` holds separately the amount and the unit associated.

fields.name: unitTaxType
fields.description: The tax type of this item. Should only be provided if different to the default credit memo tax type.

fields.name: unitAmount
fields.description: The unit sale price at time of sale or exchange

fields.name: unitCostAmount
fields.description: The unit cost price at time of sale or exchange.

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The item amount for this item excluding tax. This is a calculated value based on business rules that does not necessarily have to take into account the unit quantity or amounts.

fields.name: taxAmount
fields.description: The tax amount for this item. If not present at the item level, tax amount should be generated based on the tax type set at the invoice parent level.

typesUsed.name: ReturnOrderItemKey
typesUsed.description: Input type to uniquely identify a `ReturnOrderItem` object. We use all the fields present in the request to look for this object.

fields.name: ref
fields.description: The client's reference identifier for the object

fields.name: returnOrder
fields.description: Return order associated with the order item

typesUsed.name: ReturnOrderKey
typesUsed.description: Input type to uniquely identify a `ReturnOrder` object. We use all the fields present in the request to look for this object.

fields.name: ref
fields.description: The client's reference identifier for the object

fields.name: retailer
fields.description: The associated retailer for this return order

typesUsed.name: ProductKey
typesUsed.description: The `ProductKey` input is the parameter for identifying a specific Product.

fields.name: ref
fields.description:
Product reference identifier.
Max character limit: 100.

fields.name: catalogue
fields.description: The Product Catalogue in which this Product resides

typesUsed.name: ProductCatalogueKey
typesUsed.description: The `ProductCatalogueKey` input is the parameter for identifying a specific Product Catalogue.

fields.name: ref
fields.description:
Product Catalogue reference identifier.
Max character limit: 100.

typesUsed.name: TaxTypeInput
typesUsed.description: Input structure for creating or updating a `TaxType` on a `Product`. If `country` and `group` match, it will UPDATE, otherwise it will CREATE. All fields are required.

typesUsed.name: InvoiceKey
typesUsed.description: Input type to uniquely identify an `Invoice` object. We use all the fields present in the request to look for this object.

fields.name: ref
fields.description: The client's reference identifier for the object

typesUsed.name: DateTime

fields.name: ref
fields.description: External reference. Recommended to be unique.

fields.name: deliveryType
fields.description: Type of delivery. Supported values are _STANDARD_, _OVERNIGHT_ and _EXPRESS_.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
Type of the `Fulfilment`, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied. Unless stated otherwise, no values are enforced by the platform.
Type of the Fulfilment. Supports all values.

fields.name: eta
fields.description: Estimated time of completing this fulfilment

typesUsed.name: CreateFulfilmentItemWithFulfilmentInput
typesUsed.description: Input type to create a `FulfilmentItem` with a `Fulfilment`. Intended to be used as an inline input in the _createFulfilment_ mutation.

fields.name: ref
fields.description: External reference. Recommended to be unique.

fields.name: requestedQuantity
fields.description: Number of `OrderItem`s assigned to the fulfilment

typesUsed.name: UpdateFulfilmentInput
typesUsed.description: Input type to update a `Fulfilment`

fields.name: status
fields.description:
The current status of the `Fulfilment`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration

fields.name: deliveryType
fields.description: Type of delivery. Supported values are _STANDARD_, _OVERNIGHT_ and _EXPRESS_.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
Type of the `Fulfilment`, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied. Unless stated otherwise, no values are enforced by the platform.
Type of the Fulfilment. Supports all values.

fields.name: eta
fields.description: Estimated time of completing this fulfilment

typesUsed.name: UpdateFulfilmentItemWithFulfilmentInput
typesUsed.description: Input type to update a Fulfilment

fields.name: requestedQuantity
fields.description: Number of `OrderItem`s assigned to the fulfilment

typesUsed.name: UpdateOrderInput
typesUsed.description: Input type to update an `Order`

fields.name: status
fields.description:
The current status of the `Order`.
By default, the initial value will be CREATED, however no other status values are enforced by the platform.
The status field is also used within ruleset selection during orchestration. For more info, see Orchestration

typesUsed.name: UpdateOrderItemWithOrderInput
typesUsed.description:
Input type to update an `OrderItem` with an `Order`. Intended to be used as an inline input in the _updateOrder_ mutation.

**NOTE**
This mutation has potential implications on existing `Order`s and their workflows. We recommend this mutation to be not used directly. It should either be called from a user action or from within a workflow.

fields.name: ref
fields.description: External reference for the object. Recommended to be unique.

fields.name: productRef
fields.description: External reference for the associated product.

fields.name: productCatalogueRef
fields.description:
External reference for the product catalogue containing the associated product (specified using the `productRef`in this object).
 When `productCatalogueRef` is not passed, the compatibility catalogue for this product is used.

fields.name: fulfilmentChoiceRef
fields.description: Represents the `FulfilmentChoice` corresponding to this object

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of the OrderItem. Currently supported values are limited to _CREATED_, _NEW_, _COMPLETE_.

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Currency. Should ideally be a 3 letter ISO currency code. For instance _AUD_.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: List of `OrderItem` `attribute`s. There's expected a JSON object

typesUsed.name: CreateFinancialTransactionInput
typesUsed.description: Financial Transaction

fields.name: type
fields.description:
Type of the `FinancialTransaction`, typically used by the Orchestration Engine to determine the workflow that should be applied. Unless stated otherwise, no values are enforced by the platform.
Max character limit: 25.

fields.name: cardType
fields.description: The card type used for the payment. Possible values are 'MASTERCARD', 'VISA', 'AMEX', 'DINERS', 'SPAN', 'DISCOVER', 'UNIONPAY', 'JCB', 'MAESTRO', 'INTERAC'.

typesUsed.name: CustomerKey
typesUsed.description: Input type to uniquely identify a `Customer` object. We use all the fields present in the request to look for this object.

fields.name: ref
fields.description: The client's reference identifier for the object

fields.name: ref
fields.description:
External reference. Must be unique.
Max character limit: 100.

typesUsed.name: CreateReturnOrderItemWithReturnOrderInput
typesUsed.description: Input type to create return order items when creating a return order

fields.name: ref
fields.description:
External reference. Must be unique.
Max character limit: 100.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A list of attributes. Attributes can be used to extend the existing data structure with additional data for use in orchestration rules, etc.

fields.name: product
fields.description: Product reference of return order item

fields.name: orderItem
fields.description: Order item of return order item. This field is optional

fields.name: returnReasonComment
fields.description: Additional comments related to the returning item

fields.name: returnCondition
fields.description: The condition in which the return item was received

fields.name: returnConditionComment
fields.description: An optional comment. Required if the condition code required further information such as 'Other'.

fields.name: returnPaymentAction
fields.description: The actual payment action taken for this return item

fields.name: returnDispositionAction
fields.description: The actual disposition action taken for this return item

fields.name: unitAmount
fields.description: Unit price of the returning item

fields.name: unitTaxType
fields.description: Unit tax type of the retuning item

fields.name: itemTaxAmount
fields.description: Item tax amount of the returning item

fields.name: itemAmount
fields.description: Item total amount of returning item

typesUsed.name: CreditMemoKey
typesUsed.description: Input type to uniquely identify a `CreditMemo` object. We use all the fields present in the request to look for this object.

fields.name: ref
fields.description: The client's reference identifier for the object

typesUsed.name: CreateReturnOrderInput
typesUsed.description: Input type to create return order

fields.name: ref
fields.description:
External reference of the return order. Must be unique.
Max character limit: 100.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
Type of the return order.
Max character limit: 50.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A list of attributes of the return order. Attributes can be used to extend the existing data structure with additional data for use in orchestration rules, etc.

fields.name: customer
fields.description: Customer reference of the return order. This links the customer to return order

fields.name: order
fields.description: Linked order for this return order

fields.name: returnVerifications
fields.description: List of return verifications associated with the return order

fields.name: returnAuthorisationKey
fields.description: The generated key representing an authorised return order which the customer can use to progress through the return order proces

fields.name: returnAuthorisationDisposition
fields.description: The authorised disposition for this return order. This can be different to the return disposition action which reflects the actual action once an item has been inspected

fields.name: returnAuthorisationKeyExpiry
fields.description: The time at which the return authorisation expires

fields.name: pickupAddress
fields.description: The pickup address in the cases of return orders that are being picked up by a carrier

fields.name: lodgedLocation
fields.description: The lodged location in cases where the return order was directly returned to a store or DC

fields.name: destinationLocation
fields.description: The destination of the return order items

fields.name: returnOrderItems
fields.description: The list of associated return order items

fields.name: exchangeOrder
fields.description: The associated exchange order managed the exchange item

fields.name: creditMemo
fields.description: The associated credit memo for this return order

fields.name: defaultTaxType
fields.description: The default Tax Type for this return order. Individual return order items can override

fields.name: subTotalAmount
fields.description: The total amount of this return order excluding tax

fields.name: totalTax
fields.description: The total amount of tax for this return order

fields.name: totalAmount
fields.description: The total amount of this return order including tax
